intro: Aniseia martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique anise or the island anise, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to those of other members of its family. Aniseia martinicensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to grow in sandy soils.
